definition: to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement

sentences.english: It's the in-thing to do at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 这是目前最时兴的做法了。

sentences.english: The man cocked his hat in the latest fashion.
sentences.chinese: 这个男人按照最近时兴的方式歪戴着帽子。

sentences.english: Today's chart of the day unites these two popular topics.
sentences.chinese: 今天的“今日图表”将汇总这两个时兴话题。

sentences.english: Jun 6 to eat the most fashionable "wrapped roll."

sentences.chinese: 裤脚留卷边又时兴起来了。

sentences.english: Flared trousers are out this year .
That style of coat came first into fashion when I was a boy.
sentences.chinese: 这种式样的大衣是我做孩子的时候开始时兴的。

sentences.english: This custom has fallen into abeyance now.
sentences.chinese: 这个风俗现在已经不时兴了。

sentences.english: Nylon stockings came in soon after the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 战后不久尼龙袜子就时兴起来。

sentences.english: She bobbed her hair to be in style .
sentences.chinese: 她把头发剪成时兴的短发。

definition: to be in vogue/to be prevalent
to keep up with the latest fashion
old-fashioned/out of date/to be later than the time stipulated or agreed upon
to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
new generation of youths (generation X, Y etc)
rare/uncommon/rarity/to value as a rarity/to cherish/Taiwan pr. [xi1 han3]
variant of 玩意兒|玩意儿[wan2 yi4 r5]
